greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Triangle, read by rows, equal to the matrix inverse of A104557 and related to Laguerre polynomials.
comment: Even-indexed rows are found in A066667 (generalized Laguerre polynomials). Odd-indexed rows are found in A021009 (Laguerre polynomials L_n(x)). Row sums equal A056920 (offset 1). Absolute row sums equal A056953 (offset 1).
link: G. C. Greubel, Rows n=0..100 of triangle, flattened
example: Unsigned columns read downwards equals rows of matrix inverse A104557 read backwards:
mathematica: T[n_, k_] := (-1)^(n - k)*(n - k)!*Binomial[1 + Floor[n/2], k + 1 - Floor[(n + 1)/2]]*Binomial[Floor[(n+1)/2], k -Floor[n/2]]; Table[T[n, k], {n, 0, 20}, {k, 0, n}]//Flatten (* _G. C. Greubel_, May 14 2018 *)
program: (MAGMA) /* As triangle */ [[(-1)^(n-k)*Factorial(n-k)*Binomial(1+ Floor(n/2), k +1 -Floor((n+1)/2))*Binomial(Floor((n+1)/2), k - Floor(n/2)): k in [0..n]]: n in [0..10]]; // _G. C. Greubel_, May 14 2018
results.author: _Paul D. Hanna_, Mar 16 2005
